newsitem.title: USA: Circle opens office in Guam.
newsitem.headline: Circle opens office in Guam.

text.p: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 22 - Freight forwarder Circle International said it has opened a fully owned, full-service office in Agana, Guam. The Guam operation will serve as Circle's cargo gateway for Saipan and the rest of Micronesia.

Circle, the operating arm of Harper Group, said the Agana operation will focus initially on This new, fully-owned operation will focus largely on air and ocean inbound freight management, breakbulk, customs clearance, onforwarding and local delivery.

Ken Turnham, Circle's president and chief operating officer for Asia and the South Pacific, noted that the Guam market has considerable potential because virtually all consumer goods are imported and the forwarding market, though large, is undeveloped. -- Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+44 171 542 5017
